heisig_chinese_memo: This odd looking shellfish gets around with two animal legs - one giant leg and one little one.  It does have a healthy looking shell and eyes though.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Eye thought I saw a shellfish legging it down the beach!
origin_of_ch_char_book: The Shang Dynasty was established in a location far away from the sea, so it was difficult to get seashells. Yet very beautiful round seashells are found in the Shang Dynasty tombs. Such precious shells were used as currency. In Hanzi=tzu, many words and symbols refer to seashells. Several words are related to the seashell. For example, (Âæó, de, get) shows hand bending a finger (ÂØ∏, cun=ts‚Äôun, a small unit of length) to pick up a seashell (Ë¥ù, bei, shellfish, the original type is) on the road. (Ë°å, xing=hsing, walk). It literally means ‚Äúwalking down to the road and picking up a seashell by chance‚Äù.

shell
Basic explanation of words
shell
(shell)
b√®i
Clams, pearl mothers, knives, clams, and other shell mollusks are collectively referred to as shellfish.
Refers to the hard shell of shellfish: shells. shell carving.
Ancient currency made of shells.
name.
shell
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªb√®iÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Bogeqie, go to Thailand, help. ]
Traditional characters for "Ë¥ù1". Also known as "ËõΩ1".
(1) The general term for shell mollusks such as clams.
(2) Shells.
(3) Yu Jie's teeth are neat and white. The words "Zhuangzi ¬∑ Pirates": "The lips are like a pill of excitement, and the teeth are like qibei."
(4) Describe the whiteness and neatness of teeth.
(5) Ancient currency.
(6) Refers generally to goods.
(7) The name of the brocade with shell-shaped patterns.
(8) The name of the instrument. Also called law conch or law lily. In ancient times, it was used for festival music, monk Taoism was used for rituals, and sometimes used for soldiers and gathering crowds.
(9) Abbreviation of Bedoro. The ancient Indian Buddhist scriptures were written on the bay leaf, so it refers to the Buddhist scriptures.
(10) The provincial name of Jibei. That is kapok. See "Bei Qiu".
(11) The name of the ancient state. It was built in the Northern Zhou Dynasty and changed to Enzhou in Song Dynasty. Tang administers the two counties of Qinghe in Hebei, Linqing in Shandong and Wucheng and Xiajin counties today.
(12) Last name. There was Bei Yu in the Three Kingdoms. See "Three Kingdoms¬∑Weizhi¬∑Liu Biao Biography", "Biao Yi unites the army to Xiangyang" Pei Songzhi quoted Jin Si Ma Biao's "Strategy."
shell

shellfish, cowrie
shell
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] „ÄÄË¥ù; Kangxi Strokes: 7; Page Number: Page 1213 No. 21
„ÄêTang Yun„Äë„ÄêJi Yun„Äë„ÄêRhyme Meeting„Äë? Bogeqie, the sound is Qi. [Piya] shellfish is used for its back, so it is called shellfish. [Said the text] Sea insects are also. The ancients bought shells and treasured turtles, and there were springs in the week, and until the Qin spent shells to make money. „ÄêErya¬∑Shiyu„ÄëBeijing Lu Wei, the one who is in the water, the big one, the small one?. [Note] The big shell is like a car channel, and the thin shell is also purple. [Also] Yu Bi Huang Baiwen. [Note] Yellow is the quality, white text is the point. „ÄêAlso„ÄëYu Quan Bai Huangwen. [Note] White is the quality, yellow is the point of text, and today is also the purple shell. [Also] The worm is rich and powerful. [Note] The central and broad sides are sharp at both ends.
